item.comment: Really nice 18xx game with a great mix of company types.

item.name: 1830: Railways & Robber Barons
item.comment: One of my all-time favorites, no luck and complete information (at least the way we play it with open player treasuries). The only downside is the length to play.
1850/1870 rules plus mergers.
My least favorite 18xx game, as the development seems to set in stone with little opportunity for individual strategy.
IMHO, the most complex 18xx game there is. Companies can own other companies, very steep train rush, many different ways to raise money to keep your companies alive.

item.name: 1844: Switzerland
item.comment: A great new 18xx game. Two huge innovations - foreign investors steal a train at the end of each set of operating rounds, helping avoid the poison 4 (or other) train nobody wants to buy, and the player order is determined by money. Very interesting mix of companies with different number of shares available as well.

item.conditiontext: New games available for purchase -- see http://www.deepthoughtgames.com/games/1846/

item.name: 1848: Australia
item.comment: Bank of England adds interesting twist.
Retains most of the rules from 1870 (1850 was actually developed first, but Mayfair published 1870 first), but with shorter playing time (YMMV).
Very nice 18xx.
A bit more sedate 18xx experience. More emphasis on operating a profitable company than stock manipulations.
Nice and quick, beginner version good for introducing new players to 18xx. Tile mix is a bit too tight in the non-beginner version for my taste -- so I just always play with the beginner tiles.

item.name: 18AL
item.comment: Nice quick 18xx.

item.name: 18EU
item.comment: Different viewpoint on 18xx -- corporations can only be started by exchanging minor companies, with the emphasis more on optimizing your runs rather than stock manipulation or aggressive track laying.
item.conditiontext: I am publishing it and make it available via the web -- see the Ordering Information link.

item.name: 18FL
item.comment: Nice introduction to 18xx, yet still holds interest for experienced players.

item.name: 18GA
item.comment: Doesn't seem as balanced as 18AL, which is equally short.

item.name: 18GL
item.comment: Interesting mix of mechanics from different games, most closely related to 1826.
item.conditiontext: I produce this and other 18xx titles, and offer them in various levels from complete games to leaving large amounts of work to the buyer. See http://www.deepthoughtgames.com/games/18GL for details.

item.name: 18MEX
item.conditiontext: New, made to order -- see www.deepthoughtgames.com

item.name: 18Scan
item.comment: Includes many mechanisms from the 18xx series and is short, so it serves as a good introductory game although there may be too many things going on for a beginner. Still retains interest for 18xx veterans.
item.conditiontext: My wife and I own Deep Thought Games, LLC who publishes this game. We offer many configurations from printed to fully assembled and ready-to-play.

item.name: 18VA
item.comment: Longer than it seems it should be for the map size & number of companies.

item.name: 6 Billion
item.comment: Interesting mechanics, but too long and seems to be just missing some small bit that would make it a great game. Very cut-throat.

item.name: Advanced Civilization
item.comment: Very nice game, but incredibly long.

item.name: Advanced Squad Leader
item.comment: Too detail oriented for me, but I can see the appeal of the quality of the simulation.

item.name: Age of Renaissance
item.comment: Like AdvCiv, but keeps much of the interesting part in a much shorter game.

item.name: Age of Steam
item.comment: A bit long, but many novel ideas.

item.name: Air Baron
item.comment: Nice expansion game, reminds me of Medieval Merchant.

item.name: Aladdin's Dragons
item.comment: Nice hidden bidding game.

item.name: Alhambra
item.comment: Solid game, moderate luck. Expansions add interesting twists.

item.name: Das Amulett
item.comment: Clever bidding mechanisms. Only quibble is the way cards are auctioned, but easily fixed.

item.name: Amun-Re
item.comment: Another clever bidding mechanism, well balanced.

item.name: Apples to Apples
item.comment: Quick party game

item.name: Army of Frogs
item.comment: Very nice mix of mechanics - can be a real brain-burner, especially with 2 players.

item.name: Attila
item.comment: Scoring in a region seems too all-or-nothing

item.name: Battle Cry
item.comment: Interesting card mechanic

item.name: Battle Line
item.comment: Clever mechanism with tactics cards

item.name: BattleTech
item.comment: Very nice simulation, disliked the changes FASA made with the clan technology that unbalanced things.

item.name: The Big Idea
item.comment: Interesting, but limited replay value.

item.name: Blackbeard
item.comment: One of the few games that is optimal with 3. As with many AH games, a bit long.

item.name: Blokus
item.comment: 2 or 4 -- 3 doesn't work well. Suffers a bit in 4 players if two neighbors gang up on one player.

item.name: BrewMaster: The Craft Beer Game
item.comment: Light and fluffy.

item.name: Bridgette
item.comment: Not bad bridge-like game for 2.

item.name: Careers
item.comment: Seems like a kids game with little choice that matters.

item.name: Cartagena
item.comment: Clever movement mechanism

item.name: Catan: Cities & Knights
item.comment: My favorite of the Settlers, equal with Starfarers.

item.name: Cheops
item.comment: Quick, strategy deeper than first appears.

item.name: Chess
item.comment: The father of all strategy games. I do a lot of work still on computing chess endgame databases.

item.name: Chez Geek
item.comment: Funnier to read the cards than to play.

item.name: Chrononauts
item.comment: Light and entertaining

item.name: The Cigar Game
item.comment: Interesting rummy twist, but rather light.

item.name: Citadels
item.comment: English cards are nice, new powers are hit and miss.

item.name: La Città
item.comment: What Settler's should have been

item.name: Clippers
item.comment: Tiny bits are a turn off, but otherwise nice game

item.name: Clue
item.comment: Classic deduction game

item.name: Coloretto
item.comment: Light and fast, but deeper than it first appears

item.name: Cosmic Encounter
item.comment: The mother of all maellable rules games

item.name: Cranium
item.comment: I suck at many parts of this, but I am good at blind drawing :).

item.name: Dia de los Muertos
item.comment: I need to understand partnership strategy better

item.name: A Dog's Life
item.comment: Light and fluffy, but entertaining.

item.name: Don
item.comment: Interesting bidding mechanics

item.name: Dune: The Duel
item.comment: Nice expansion to dune.

item.name: Elfengold
item.comment: Improves elfenland.

item.name: En Garde
item.comment: Cute 2-player

item.name: Europa 1945-2030
item.comment: Die Macher light, but still too long

item.name: Federation & Empire
item.comment: Campaign game for SFB, but seems to miss something

item.name: Flight Leader
item.comment: Nice air wargame

item.name: Fluxx
item.comment: Very random but entertaining

item.name: Formula Dé
item.comment: Some of the tracks are really great -- make you feel like you are really racing on the track.

item.name: Formula Dé Circuits 23 - 26: USA Track Pack #1
Formula Dé Circuits 27 - 30: USA Track Pack #2
Fresh Fish
item.comment: Still don't know what auctions are worth :(

item.name: Give Me the Brain!
item.comment: Quite funny, but perhaps only a few times

item.name: Goldbräu
item.comment: Good mix of strategy and luck, sometimes unlucky cards can doom a player but usually not too harsh.

item.name: El Grande: König & Intrigant – Player's Edition
Hannibal: Rome vs. Carthage
item.comment: Nice card system

item.name: Hare & Tortoise
item.comment: Very cool game - looks like a kid's game but definitely deep strategy.

item.name: High Tail It!
item.comment: Great fun, can be a real brain-burner. Vulnerable to a weak player skewing the game.

item.name: How Much for the Camel?
item.comment: Not bad cheap auction game

item.name: James Ernest's Totally Renamed Spy Game
item.comment: Very funny, gameplay gets a bit mundane after a few plays.

item.name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot
item.comment: Too random

item.name: Kingmaker
item.comment: Very long, but cool game

item.name: Kremlin
item.comment: I love the indirection of hidden influence.

item.name: League of Six
item.comment: Interesting combination of mechanics. Goods placement in warehouses is a bit too much about screwing over others rather than helping yourself.

item.name: Liar's Dice
item.comment: Great bluffing fun

item.name: Loopin' Louie
item.comment: Surprisingly fun

item.name: Die Macher
item.comment: Incredible game, only drawback is length and rules translation.

item.name: Machiavelli
item.comment: Diplomacy plus economics

item.name: Magic: The Gathering
item.comment: Like the strategy, hate the CCG aspect

item.name: Die Magier von Pangea
item.comment: Very interesting collection game.

item.name: Mare Nostrum
item.comment: Seemed to get into infinite "jump the leader" cycle

item.name: Merchant of Venus
item.comment: Classic AH exploration and trade cycle game

item.name: Modern Art
item.comment: Seminal auction game.

item.name: Monopoly
item.comment: Deeper strategy than given credit for.

item.name: Nicht die Bohne!
item.comment: So easy to screw others, so hard to help yourself

item.name: Nur Peanuts!
item.comment: Deeper than it first appears

item.name: Oregon
item.comment: Would play where you can discard and draw up to four as your action to minimize screwage with bad cards.

item.name: PitchCar Extension
item.comment: You really need this with Carabande.

item.name: Poker
item.comment: No good at bluffing and reading

item.name: Power Grid
item.comment:
One of my favorite games -- I loved it so much I spent a lot of time and money building better components for it. Check out my PS and PDF downloads.
Hmm, they changed the entry -- my rating and comment is for Funkenschlag (the original version). I feel that Power Grid takes everything great about Funkenschlag and trashes it.

item.name: Programmer's Nightmare
item.comment: Fun a few times with other programmers

item.name: Quarto!
item.comment: Real brain-burner

item.name: Rail Baron
item.comment: Monopoly where the properties get you connectivity. Too long, but otherwise quite enjoyable.

item.name: The Republic of Rome
item.comment: Incredibly complex, but the payoff is great. Masterful combination of influence, negotation, and working together to beat the game.

item.name: Ricochet Robots
item.comment: Outstanding puzzle game.

item.name: Risk 2210 A.D.
item.comment: Still too long, but improved from the original.

item.name: RoboRally
item.comment: Fun, but too long in a cut-throat group

item.name: Saint Petersburg
item.comment: Quick, varied strategies, moderate luck.

item.name: Save Doctor Lucky
item.comment: It is much more interesting to try and save him than kill him

item.name: Scotland Yard
item.comment: Nice deduction and hidden movement game. Hidden player must be good or it isn't a good game.

item.name: The Siege of Jerusalem (second edition)
item.comment: Plays well solitaire

item.name: Siesta
item.comment: If one player is poor, ruins whole game

item.name: Simply Cosmic
item.comment: Good introduction, but buy the whole set.

item.name: Sorry!
item.comment: Mindless

item.name: Star Fleet Battles
item.comment: Great game, but I don't play it enough to compete with those who are good at it.

item.name: Steam over Holland
item.comment: Nice intro game for beginners, still interesting for veterans. Awesome components.

item.name: Survival of the Witless
item.comment: Funnier to read the cards than to play.

item.name: Tikal
item.comment: Java and/or Mexica take similar themes and do better with them.

item.name: Titan
item.comment: Totally awesome game, just takes a long time. Collussus helps that.

item.name: TransAmerica
item.comment: Quick and simple, yet the strategy is deeper than it looks at first.

item.name: Trapper
item.comment: Too random.

item.name: Ur: 1830 BC
item.comment: Nice quicker 18xx game.

item.name: Vinci
item.comment: Nice expansion of risk idea with civ counters, and never out of the game

item.name: Warhammer 40,000
item.comment: Eek

item.name: Warhamster Rally
item.comment: Quicker and simpler RoboRally.

item.name: We the People
item.comment: Interesting card mechanic, better used elsewhere

item.name: Wheedle
item.comment: Better than pit, although much less trading between players
